name: vcf_to_variants
title: VCF Importer
summary: Converts a VCF file into a Variants table object
description: Converts a VCF file into a Variants table object. (Variants objects can be then used as inputs to certain variation annotation apps, etc.; they can also be visualized in the genome browser).

inputSpec.name: vcf
inputSpec.label: VCF file
inputSpec.help: The VCF file to be imported.

inputSpec.name: reference
inputSpec.label: Reference genome
inputSpec.help: The genome that the VCF entries refer to. DNAnexus provides several common genomes in the 'Reference Genomes' public project. (If you need to make your own genome, use the 'Genome Importer' app).

inputSpec.name: output name
inputSpec.label: Output name
inputSpec.help: The name of the resulting Variants table object (optional; if not provided, the name will be based on the VCF filename).

inputSpec.name: tags
inputSpec.label: Tags
inputSpec.help: A set of tags (string labels) that will be added to the resulting Variants table object. (You can use tags and properties to better describe and organize your data).

inputSpec.name: properties
inputSpec.label: Properties
inputSpec.help: A set of properties (key/value pairs) that will be added to the resulting Variants table object. (You can use tags and properties to better describe and organize your data).

inputSpec.name: compress_reference
inputSpec.label: Condense contiguous reference rows?
inputSpec.help: If selected, contiguous reference calls in the genome will be condensed to one row.

inputSpec.name: compress_no_call
inputSpec.label: Condense contiguous no-call rows?
inputSpec.help: If selected, contiguous no-calls in the genome (VCF rows for which the genotype is './.') will be condensed to one row.

inputSpec.name: infer_no_call
inputSpec.label: Infer missing as no-call?
inputSpec.help: If selected, regions of the genome lacking data in the VCF file will be labelled as "No-call".

inputSpec.name: file_encoding
inputSpec.label: Input character encoding
inputSpec.help: The character encoding to use when parsing the VCF file (optional; default is 'utf8').

inputSpec.name: additional_types
inputSpec.label: Additional types
inputSpec.help: A comma separated list of additional types that the output object will be marked with (by default the output object type is 'Variants', but you can specify additional types here).

outputSpec.name: variants
outputSpec.label: Variants
outputSpec.help: The resulting Variants table object. (Developers can look at http://wiki.dnanexus.com/Types/Variants for more information).
